1.description: Maintain and retain multiple copies of sensitive or proprietary data and servers in a physically separate, segmented, and secure location (e.g., hard drive, storage device, the cloud).

2.command: Require all accounts with password logins to comply with NIST’s standards
2.description: Require employees to use long passwords and consider not requiring recurring password changes.

3.description: Enable multifactor authentication for all services to the extent possible, particularly for webmail, VPN, and accounts that access critical systems.

4.command: Keep all operating systems, software, and firmware up to date
4.description: Timely patching is one of the most efficient and cost-effective steps an organization can take to minimize its exposure to cybersecurity threats. Prioritize patching known exploited vulnerabilities in internet-facing systems.

5.description: Network segmentation can help prevent the spread of ransomware by controlling traffic flows between—and access to—various subnetworks and by restricting adversary lateral movement.

6.command: Identify, detect, and investigate abnormal activity
6.description: Implement a tool that logs and reports all network traffic, including lateral movement activity on a network. Endpoint detection and response (EDR) tools are particularly useful for detecting lateral connections.

7.description: Prevent unknown or untrusted origins from accessing remote services on internal systems.

8.command: Install, regularly update, and enable real-time detection for antivirus software
8.description: Ensure antivirus software is installed, regularly updated, and real-time detection is enabled on all hosts.

9.command: Review domain controllers, servers, workstations, and active directories for new and/or unrecognized accounts
9.description: Regularly review and audit for new or unrecognized accounts.

10.command: Audit user accounts with administrative privileges
10.description: Configure access controls according to the principle of least privilege.

11.description: Ensure that unused ports are disabled to reduce attack surfaces.

12.command: Consider adding an email banner to emails received from outside of your organization
12.description: Add an email banner to help identify emails from external sources.

13.description: Prevent users from clicking on potentially malicious links in emails.

14.command: Implement time-based access for accounts set at the admin level and higher
14.description: Use the Just-in-Time (JIT) access method to provision privileged access when needed.

15.command: Disable command-line and scripting activities and permissions
15.description: Prevent privilege escalation and lateral movement by disabling command-line and scripting activities.

16.description: Regularly maintain backup and restoration to ensure data is not lost.

17.command: Ensure all backup data is encrypted and immutable
17.description: Make sure backup data cannot be altered or deleted and covers the entire organization’s data infrastructure.
